comments:
Build ID: M20060921-0945
Eclipse Version: 3.2.1

Steps To Reproduce:
1. In the Project Explorer, select a EJB Project, expand it, select an Entity bean, right click it, Select Webservices, select Create Webservice, click it. This causes, "IWAB0014E Unexpected exception occured."

2. Select the package name in the entity project, right click, select New, select Other, select WebService in the popup. Same error as above is encountered.

3. Select the package name in the entity project, right click, select New, select Other, select WebService Client in the popup. Nothing happens.

NB: The points 1,2 and 3 above are mutually exclusive.

More information:

This one sounds similar : 

https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=152863

Can you please tell me how to do I find the version of my wtp installation ?

Regards,
Nagesh
Although creation from EJBs is not supported yet (see RFE bug 89922), the wizard should not throw an NPE. Kathy, please have a look at cases 2 & 3.

From the build ID, it sounds like it is from WTP 1.5.x.  Could you please retry your scenario with the latest WTP 2.0.1 driver:

http://download.eclipse.org/webtools/downloads/drops/R2.0/R-2.0.1-20070926042742/

If the problem is still there, please attach a more up-to-date stack trace.  There had been some fix in that area and might have fixed the problem.  Please note that we currently do not support creating Axis Web services on EJBs.
